titleInfo.title: John L. Wallace Korean War training photo album

mods.abstract: Photo album created by Corporal John L. Wallace during his military training at Fort McCoy in Wisconsin.

titleInfo.title: John L. Wallace Korean War training photo album, front cover

mods.abstract: Cover of album includes the text "Photographs" and "Camp McCoy, Wisc." The Great Seal, which includes a bald eagle and the text "E. Pluribus Unum" is present.

titleInfo.title: John L. Wallace Korean War Training Photo Album
John L. Wallace Korean Conflict Photo Album

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: John L. Wallace Korean War training photo album, page 1

mods.abstract: This page features "Autographs of my friends." A date, signature, address, and message is included for each contributor. The messages date from 1950-1951 and include well wishes like "Be cool, my man."

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: John L. Wallace Korean War training photo album, page 23

mods.abstract: Page includes two photographs of named individuals. The photo on the left captures a group of soliders and includes inscriptions indicating the name and origin of each individual. The names and origins listed are: James Stewart (Fresn Cal.), Joe Vachon (Rumford Maine), Ollie Bunn (Wilson N.C.) Percy Johnston (??), Sabeme Bey (Toledo O.) Cris Gwisham (Toledo O.), Lonnie Lewis (Chicago Ill.) and Fred Bonaparte (Phila. Pa.). Also inscribed is "brks 6217" (barracks 6217). Wallace has also included arrows to his bunk and the war hawks field baseball park. The photo on the right includes the inscription "My dad" and depicts a Black man in a vest in front of a garden with tulips.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Valentine of a heart-shaped box and flowers

mods.abstract: Valentine created by Gibson Greeting Gards and signed "As ever, 'Dinky.'" Message on the front of the card reads: "A valentine message for the one I love." Interior message reads: "For you alone. There's the sweetest love in our hearts / That only the two of us share . . . / And, darling, wherever you go / My love will always be there ~ / For each little thought I have / Seems only to be of you, / Because I'm so much in love, dear . . . / and hope you love ME / that much too!"

titleInfo.title: Milbank Agricultural building postcard

mods.abstract: Postcard depicts the Milbank Agricultural building at the Tuskegee Institute in Alabama. The building is made of red brick and includes a porte cochere. The card is sent from Tommy in Alabama to Sgt. John L. Wallace in Michigan. It shares that the sender is fine and that Sgt. Wallace should get in touch with family.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: District of Columbia National Guard card for John L. Wallace

mods.abstract: The card includes Wallace's name, signature, serial number, company, and unit commander (Robert S. Williams). Wallace's full name is given as John Lamond Wallace and his company is listed as "Co C 171st M.P. Bn DCNG." The card was issued on July 19, 1948. It notes that the holder is charged "with uniform and courteous military bearing and action."
